summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions and statements, determines that the situation in South Sudan continues to threaten international peace and security. Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, it decides to extend the mandate of the UN Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS) until 12 August 2016, as outlined in resolution 2252 (2015), and authorizes UNMISS to use all necessary means to carry out its tasks. The Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
